titleStmt.title: Charles Lind v. John F. Sheehan and H.G. Thornton. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus

bibl.title: Charles Lind v. Defendant. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: In the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Port Townsend

Upon reading and filing the Petition of Charles Lind duly signed and verified by him, whereby it appears that he is illegaly imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by John F. Sheehan Sheriff of Jefferson County W.T. and H.G. Thornton Constable of King County and stating wherein the alleged illegality consists, from which it appears to me that a Writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue, it is ordered that a Writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the seal of the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Port Townsend directed to said John F. Sheehan and H.G. Thornton, commanding them to have the body of the said Charles Lind before me in the Court Room of the said Court, at the County of Jefferson on the 24th day of August AD 1885, at 4 o'clock P.M. of said day to do and
receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said petitioner Charles Lind, together with the time and cause of his detention, and that you have then and there the said Writ
In the Dist Court holding terms at Port Townsend
In the matter of the application of Charles Lind for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
